page.title: 04ECOLOGY (COUNTRY PARK ONE)
page.content: The greater part of Snelsmore common consists of a plateau 450ft above sea level and the common covers 120 acres of land owned by three different Lords of the Manor.With its clay base and overlying gravel the soil is rather infertile so birch is very prevalent along with heather and ferns.Most of the common is woodland but there is a conservation area of valley bogland in which it is dangerous to set foot. Wildlife varies from deer and fox to lizards and adders.Woodpeckers, warblers,nightjars and nuthatch are seen. The Country Park was only established after 1970 as a result of Shell National Consevation Competition won by the girls of Newbury Girls Grammer School.Concrete routes and parking areas already existed.The common was used as a transport depot in W.War 2.
